title: Noetherian scheme
summary: In algebraic geometry, a noetherian scheme is a scheme that admits a finite covering by open affine subsets Spec ‚Å° A i {\displaystyle \operatorname {Spec} A_{i}} , A i {\displaystyle A_{i}} noetherian rings. More generally, a scheme is locally noetherian if it is covered by spectra of noetherian rings. Thus, a scheme is noetherian if and only if it is locally noetherian and quasi-compact.  As with noetherian rings, the concept is named after Emmy Noether.
